intro: Berlandiera tomentosa var. dealbata, commonly known as the white-flowered globemallow, is a perennial herb native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its hairy, sprawling stems and clusters of showy white or pale yellow flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and attractive plant for native gardens and ecological restoration projects.
